sections.title: What are phrasal verbs?
sections.content:
**Phrasal verb** = verb + particle with a **different meaning** from the verb alone:

• look → **look after** = take care of
• give → **give up** = stop trying
• take → **take off** = remove (clothes); leave (plane)

Very common in spoken English. Learn them as **whole phrases**.

Examples: carry out (do), set up (establish), find out (discover), put off (postpone), run out of (use up).

For the full list, see **Reference → Phrasal verb dictionary**.

sections.title: Separable vs inseparable
sections.content:
**Separable:** object can go in the middle or after.
• Turn on the light. / Turn **the light** on. With pronoun: **Turn it on.** (not: Turn on it)

**Inseparable:** object always after the particle.
• Look **after** the children. (not: look the children after)
• Run **into** a friend. Go **through** a difficult time.

See **Reference → Phrasal verb dictionary** to check which are which.

sections.title: Common particles
sections.content:
Particles often suggest direction or completion:

• **up** – complete, increase: give up, set up, fill up
• **down** – decrease, stop: calm down, turn down
• **out** – disappear, distribute: find out, run out
• **off** – disconnect, cancel: turn off, call off
• **on** – connect, continue: turn on, carry on
• **over** – transfer, review: take over, go over

Many have **more than one meaning**: take off = remove clothes / leave (plane). Use context.

Full list: **Reference → Phrasal verb dictionary**.

sections.title: Typical errors
sections.content:
• **Wrong particle:** Wrong: We *put on* the meeting (postpone). Right: We **put off** the meeting. (put on = wear)
• **Word order (separable):** Wrong: Turn *on it*. Right: **Turn it on.** (Pronoun in the middle.)
• **Say vs phrasal:** Wrong: I will *find* the information (search). Right: I will **look up** the information.
• **Similar verbs:** look **up** (search) vs look **after** (take care of) vs look **for** (search for). See **Reference → Phrasal verb dictionary**.

sections.title: Quick summary
sections.content:
• Phrasal verb = **verb + particle** = special meaning (give up = stop trying).
• **Separable:** Turn it on. **Inseparable:** look after the children.
• Learn as whole phrases. Full list: **Reference → Phrasal verb dictionary**.

questions.question: 'We need to _____ the meeting.' (postpone) Which fits?
questions.explanation: Put off = postpone. Put on = wear; put up = raise; put down = place down.

questions.question: 'Who will _____ the children?' (take care of) Which fits?
questions.explanation: Look after = take care of. Look up = search; look for = search for.

questions.question: 'Don't _____ !' (stop trying) Which fits?
questions.explanation: Give up = stop trying. Give in = yield; give out = distribute; give back = return.

questions.question: 'We've _____ milk.' (used up) Which fits?
questions.explanation: Run out of = use up, have none left. Run into = meet by chance; run over = hit.

questions.question: '_____ the light.' (switch on) With a pronoun: _____
questions.explanation: Separable phrasal verb: pronoun goes between verb and particle (Turn it on).

questions.question: 'She _____ a solution.' (thought of an idea) Which fits?
questions.explanation: Come up with = think of (an idea). Come across = find by chance; come down with = become ill.

questions.question: Please _____ with your work. (continue)
questions.explanation: Go on = continue.

questions.question: They _____ the experiment. (did, completed)
questions.explanation: Carry out = do or complete a task.

questions.question: We _____ a meeting for Monday. (arranged)
questions.explanation: Set up = establish, arrange.

questions.question: I'll _____ you at seven. (collect)
questions.explanation: Pick up = collect. Separable: pick you up.

questions.question: Don't _____ ! (stop trying)
questions.explanation: Give up = stop trying.

questions.question: _____ the word in a dictionary. (search for)
questions.explanation: Look up = search for information.

questions.question: Who will _____ the children? (take care of)
questions.explanation: Look after = take care of.

questions.question: We _____ the meeting. (postponed)
questions.explanation: Put off = postpone.

questions.question: _____ your homework. (submit)
questions.explanation: Hand in = submit.

questions.question: We've _____ of milk. (used up)
questions.explanation: Run out of = use up, have none left.

questions.question: They _____ the match. (cancelled)
questions.explanation: Call off = cancel.

questions.question: I _____ at seven. (rise from bed)
questions.explanation: Get up = rise from bed or seat.

questions.question: _____ your coat. (wear)
questions.explanation: Put on = wear; switch on.

questions.question: _____ the light. (switch off)
questions.explanation: Turn off = switch off.

questions.question: Things will _____. (succeed)
questions.explanation: Work out = succeed; exercise; calculate.

questions.question: 'Look up' means:
questions.explanation: Look up = search for information (e.g. in a dictionary).

questions.question: 'Put off' means:
questions.explanation: Put off = postpone.

questions.question: 'Take off' can mean:
questions.explanation: Take off = remove clothes; (plane) leave the ground.

questions.question: 'Run out of' means:
questions.explanation: Run out of = use up, have no more.

questions.question: 'Bring up' can mean:
questions.explanation: Bring up = raise children; mention a topic.

questions.question: 'Go through' means:
questions.explanation: Go through = experience; examine.

questions.question: 'Find out' means:
questions.explanation: Find out = discover.

questions.question: 'Take over' means:
questions.explanation: Take over = assume control.

questions.question: 'Set up' means:
questions.explanation: Set up = establish, arrange.

questions.question: 'Carry on' means:
questions.explanation: Carry on = continue.

questions.question: He _____ a solution. (thought of)
questions.explanation: Come up with = think of an idea.

questions.question: I _____ an old friend. (met by chance)
questions.explanation: Bump into = meet by chance.

questions.question: She _____ flu. (became ill with)
questions.explanation: Come down with = become ill with.

questions.question: I _____ an interesting article. (found by chance)
questions.explanation: Come across = find by chance; seem.

questions.question: They _____ last year. (ended their relationship)
questions.explanation: Break up = end a relationship; disperse.

questions.question: We _____ at home. (finally were)
questions.explanation: End up = finally do or be.

questions.question: I can't _____ this problem. (solve)
questions.explanation: Figure out = understand; solve.

questions.question: She _____ her illness. (recovered from)
questions.explanation: Get over = recover from.

questions.question: He _____ to pressure. (yielded)
questions.explanation: Give in = yield; submit.

questions.question: I _____ in Prague. (became adult)
questions.explanation: Grow up = become adult.

questions.question: _____ a second. (wait)
questions.explanation: Hang on = wait.

questions.question: _____ the good work. (maintain)
questions.explanation: Keep up = maintain; continue.

questions.question: We need to _____ the problem. (resolve)
questions.explanation: Sort out = resolve; organise.

questions.question: She didn't _____. (arrive)
questions.explanation: Show up / turn up = arrive; appear.

questions.question: _____! (be careful)
questions.explanation: Look out / Watch out = be careful.

questions.question: Wrong: 'We put on the meeting.' (meaning postponed) Correct the sentence.
questions.explanation: Put off = postpone. Put on = wear.

questions.question: Wrong: 'Turn on it.' Correct the sentence.
questions.explanation: Separable: pronoun goes between verb and particle.

questions.question: Wrong: 'I will find the information.' (meaning search for in a book) Correct using a phrasal verb.
answers: I will look up the information.
I will look up the information
questions.explanation: Look up = search for information.

questions.question: Wrong: 'Who will look the children after?' Correct the sentence.
answers: Who will look after the children?
Who will look after the children
questions.explanation: Look after is inseparable: object after particle.

questions.question: Wrong: 'We ran out milk.' Correct the sentence.
questions.explanation: Run out of = use up. We need 'of' before the thing.

questions.question: Wrong: 'Don't give in!' (meaning don't stop trying) Correct the sentence.
questions.explanation: Give up = stop trying. Give in = yield.

questions.question: Wrong: 'She came up a solution.' Correct the sentence.
answers: She came up with a solution.
She came up with a solution
questions.explanation: Come up with = think of (an idea).

questions.question: Wrong: 'They cancelled off the match.' Correct using the correct phrasal verb.
questions.explanation: Call off = cancel. We say 'call off', not 'cancel off'.

questions.question: Wrong: 'Pick up it.' Correct the sentence.
questions.explanation: Separable: pronoun in the middle (Pick it up).

questions.question: Wrong: 'I found out my keys.' (meaning I was searching for them) Correct the sentence.
answers: I was looking for my keys.
questions.explanation: Find out = discover. Look for = search for something.
